intro: Plegorhiza quicura, commonly known as the golden trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its bright yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is a member of the Bignoniaceae family, which includes other ornamental and medicinal species. Plegorhiza quicura typically grows as a woody vine, often climbing or trailing along supports. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
